## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

```{r}
#packages
library(googlesheets4)
library(tidyverse)

#Get data 
j<- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RHiKsdYIVPlScCsBkSR3lW5keFv3N-kOlPUwshgO-lM")

#pull out the type of data marked csv and split out the values by commas into two columns. 
datcsv <- j %>%
  filter(TypeData == "csv") %>% 
  select(Timestamp, Values) %>% 
  separate_rows(Values, sep = ", ") %>% 
  arrange((Values)) 






#Get rid of duplicates and count them.   
datcsv_distinct <- datcsv %>% 
  distinct(Values, .keep_all = TRUE)

datcsv_counts <- datcsv %>% 
  count(Values, sort = TRUE)
  
# Put back into GoogleSheet 
sheet <- sheet_write(df_split, sheet_name = "XOXOCommSurv_ValuesList")

```
